name: impermissibly
content:

in a way that is not allowed: The judge impermissibly allowed his personal opinions to colour his evaluation of the legal issue before him. He claimed that jurors acted impermissibly by awarding punitive damages.
More examplesFewer examplesThe district judge ruled that the ban is impermissibly vague. The text size is impermissibly small and the terms are tucked away on the final page of the long document. They argued that the proposed law would impermissibly limit people's freedom of political communication.
